definition: medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: A physician should be consulted if there is evidence of infection.
sentences.chinese: 如果存在感染的跡象，應當立即諮詢內科醫生。

sentences.english: In internist popularization psychology disease related knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 內科醫生中普及心理疾病的相關知識。

sentences.english: Xiao huang's sister is a doctor of internal medicine in the village clinic.
sentences.chinese: 黃的姐姐是鄉衛生院的一名內科醫生。

sentences.english: Physicians and health professionals should be encouraged to increase their efforts at promotion of smoking cessation in all individuals.
sentences.chinese: 內科醫生和健康專家更加積極努力地向病人推廣戒菸。

sentences.english: Huijia's uncle is studying to be a physician.
sentences.chinese: 慧嘉的叔叔正學習成爲一位內科醫生。

sentences.english: The first incision is something few physicians forget.
sentences.chinese: 很少有內科醫生會忘記他們的操持的第一刀。

sentences.english: Gallbladder trouble, the physician surmised after a quick examination.
sentences.chinese: 膽囊病，這是內科醫生在快速檢查後做的推測。

sentences.english: She said that her internist had recommended that she come.
sentences.chinese: 她說是她的內科醫生推薦她來的。

sentences.english: Bianque was a famous physician in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 扁鵲是中國古代著名的內科醫生。

sentences.english: Topics are those of current concerns to internists .
sentences.chinese: 題目是內科醫生的當今的關心的。

definition: lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
to whisper to one another's ear
to transfer (a patient) to a different hospital/to transfer to hospital (e.g. a prisoner)
to help a mother give birth
